item.title: How to update changes to Hugo blog on GitHub
item.author: Author
item.description: Make sure the local source files of the website are updated with the changes done on GitHub (if any). Skip this step if none. Go to Terminal cd my_site git pull origin master Make any changes to the files locally or add new posts. Go to my_site folder hugo new posts/second_post.md Open second_post.md using text editor and remove the property draft: true and replace it with draft: false Launch the website locally to check the updates are correct before updating to GitHub hugo serve Go to http://localhost:1313 Create the public folder and generate the necessary files required for the website in it.

item.title: How to create hugo blog on GitHub
item.author: Author
item.description: This is a guide for Mac but similar logic should be same for Windows Install hugo package brew install hugo Create the blog. Open your terminal and type in hugo new site my_site cd my_site my_site will be a new folder and also the name of your site. Pick a blog theme from Hugo. Go to https://themes.gohugo.io/ Install the theme you like.
